questions.question: The rate of a given behavior is higher in the presence of a stimulus than when that stimulus is absent. This is an example of:

An RBT was conducting a preference assessment. The client was presented with 2 stimuli at a time. The location of these was interchanged and all potential pairings were presented to the client. Which preference assessment did the RBT implement?

During naturalistic observation, a client was presented with an array of stimuli. The client was free to interact with them. As the client interacted with the potential reinforcers, the therapist was collecting the time and number of interactions. The therapist used:

During naturalistic observation, a client was presented with an array of stimuli. As the client selected stimuli, these were removed from the environment. No other stimuli were added to the array. Which preference assessment did the RBT implement?

During initial assessment, an RBT was assisting a BCaBA. The RBT was asked to pay close attention to the consequences of problematic behaviors. The BCaBA told the RBT that he wanted to hypothesize about the WHY behind the client's responses. The RBT is most likely assisting with a (n):
Which of the following is an example of an unconditioned punisher?

questions.answer: A math exercise is presented, the client finishes the exercise, a candy is given (the behavior occurs more often in the future)
options: A math exercise is presented, the client finished the exercise, no more homework (the behavior occurs more often in the future)
A math exercise is presented, the client finishes the exercise, a candy is given (the behavior occurs more often in the future)
A math exercise is presented, the client finished the exercise, a candy is given (the behavior occurs less often in the future)
A math exercise is presented, the client finished the exercise, no more homework (the behavior occurs less often in the future)
questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a Three-Term-Contingency that uses positive reinforcement?

questions.answer: Positive reinforcement, Negative reinforcement, Positive punishment, Negative punishment
options: Unconditioned stimulus, Conditioned stimulus, Neutral stimulus
Positive reinforcement, Negative reinforcement, Positive punishment, Negative punishment
questions.question: ____________________ are all involved in operant conditioning as consequences

questions.answer: Unconditioned stimulus, Conditioned stimulus, Neutral stimulus
options: Unconditioned response, Conditioned response, Respondent behaviors
Unconditioned stimulus, Conditioned stimulus, Neutral stimulus
questions.question: ____________________ are all involved in classical conditioning as antecedent conditions

questions.answer: The antecedent is what precedes behavior, and the consequences is what proceeds a behavior
options: The antecedent is what precedes behavior, and the consequences is what proceeds a behavior
The antecedent is what proceeds behavior, and the consequence is what precedes a behavior
questions.question: Difference between antecedent and consequences
